law.catch_line: In this subtitle, "place of public accommodation" means:...
law.text:
In this subtitle, "place of public accommodation" means:
an inn, hotel, motel, or other establishment that provides lodging to transient guests;
a restaurant, cafeteria, lunchroom, lunch counter, soda fountain, or other facility principally engaged in selling food or alcoholic beverages for consumption on or off the premises, including a facility located on the premises of a retail establishment or gasoline station;
a motion picture house, theater, concert hall, sports arena, stadium, or other place of exhibition or entertainment;
a retail establishment that:
is operated by a public or private entity; and
offers goods, services, entertainment, recreation, or transportation; and
an establishment:
that is physically located within the premises of any other establishment covered by this subtitle; or
within the premises of which any other establishment covered by this subtitle is physically located; and
that holds itself out as serving patrons of the covered establishment.
